tool.name: OverlapTiles

param.name: Input shapefile
param.dialogReference: Input shapefile. The shapefile needs to contain a tile layout.
param.pythonReference: Input shapefile. The shapefile needs to contain a tile layout. The layout the overlap tilelayout will be based on.

param.name: Output_Shapefile
param.dialogReference: Output path to the shapefile. The location the new shapfile will be saved to.
param.pythonReference: Output path to the shapefile. The location the new shapfile will be saved to.

param.name: X_overlap
param.dialogReference: The width value that the tile will be overlaped. Units will be in the same coordinates systems as the input tile layout shapefile.
param.pythonReference:
The width value that the tile will be overlaped. Units will be in the same coordinates systems as the input tile layout shapefile.

The horizontal shift desired. The X value.

param.name: Y_overlap
param.dialogReference: The height value that the tile will be overlaped. Units will be in the same coordinates systems as the input tile layout shapefile.
param.pythonReference:
The hortizontal value that the tile will be overlaped. Units will be in the same coordinates systems as the input tile layout shapefile.

The vertical shift desired. The Y value.

tool.summary: This tool will growth a tile layout specified in x and y options. The tools creates a new tile layout based on the input tile layout.
tool.usage: This tool will growth a tile layout specified in x and y options. The tools creates a new tile layout based on the input tile layout. Tool works along the same line as buffer.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool will growth a tile layout specified in x and y options. The tools creates a new tile layout based on the input tile layout.
